alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Macon (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 12 at 4:49PM EDT until August 12 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Macon County in western North Carolina... Southeastern Jackson County in western North Carolina... * Until 615 PM EDT. * At 449 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 5 miles southeast of Robbinsville to 4 miles northeast of Hayesville to 4 miles northeast of Blairsville, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Franklin, Highlands, Cashiers, Lake Glenville, Nantahala Lake, Ellijay, Burningtown, Kyle, Otto and Rainbow Springs. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
